intro: Antidaphne, commonly known as the Christmas rose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, shaded environments. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to conserve moisture in its native habitat. Antidaphne is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique blooming period.
